There were TWO SINGLE beds MADE UP AS TWO single beds.  Not at all conducive to a couple wanting to sleep together.  The bathroom was very small with no counter space to put things.  No bathtub, just a very small shower enclosure which in my estimation would not accommodate a very big person.  The shower doors closed right on your face with no room to bend over or turn around.. and I am not big.  Nice powerful hot shower but the drain was inadequate and flooded the entire bathroom and the area into the bedroom after only  2 or 3 minutes.  The food (we were on half board) was not great.  For a country…

title: Lovely hotel in a lovely location.
review: My wife and I stayed at the Portici for one night in early August while attending the international music festival.  We booked through on online agency and got a great room including breakfast. The hotel is slap bang in the middle of Riva del Garda, directly opposite the small port and the bell tower. The location is idyllic and totally charming. Breakfast was good and exactly as expected in Italy with a choice from a buffet and served coffee and tea etc.  We did not have an evening meal at the hotel as we chose to eat out. The restaurant looked charming and we noticed how busy it was with locals in the evening.  This is usually a good sign! Our room was a good size and we were lucky in that we had a balcony. The hotel only has two such rooms. The room was clean and modern in…

title: Don't Get Lost in this Maze!
review: Hotel Portici was very nice. I stayed there a couple of weeks ago for just one weekend. The hotel is located in a small little town. Lake Garda is right across from the hotel and there are pizza shops, gelato bars, shopping all in walking distance. Everything is right there for you. And the little town area seemed nice, and safe, too.  I checked into the hotel later in the evening. The lobby area is very small. They gave me a key with (literally) a 5 pound weight attached to it -- I guess its so you don't steal it or lose it. The elevator was so tiny and very slow, thus, I had to carry my heavy suitcase up a lot of steps. Not fun. My friends and I searched for the room for probably about 15 minutes. The rooms are in no particular order and the hotel is like a maze. It was very…

title: Excellent Hotel and Resort
review: But don't travel with Newmarket Travel, we experienced problems on most day trips, no Aircon and too tight an itinery on the coach.  We had to pay an extra £20 (2x £10) at the Airport (E Mids) for non reg at baggage check-out, although we had done so with Nmt on-line, which we have since recovered, although the person at the end of the phone was offhand and accepted repayment without checking for a ref (does that tell you something ? ) several other passengers had the same problem, second Hotel again, another alternative, for the last 4 nights out of 7 was at Cinciano Terme the san Remo nice people but still in the 70s (a feeling of decadence about it. Both places are very nice, and the places we visited will always be in our memory Rome, Sienna, Assisi, Venice Florence and…

title: Great Location, Basic Hotel
review: Booked this holiday through 'The Travel Department'  who were great, especially our guide Laura, she was very knowledgeable and helpful and gave us lots of information as we went on our tours of the Lake, Verona and Venice. The hotel is in a fantastic location, very quiet at night, but very basic. Breakfast is good especially the croissants, but the evening meal (which you must order the night before and eat at a certain time) is not that great.  You get a choice of salad which is basic, pasta which is the same every night but with a different sauce, meat (one small slice)and potatoes followed by a nice dessert (but never ice cream). If you accidently spill sauce or wine on the tablecloth it is not changed for two days. Water and wine are charged at 2 euro. Rooms are very small…

title: Very basic & very clean,
review: Very basic hotel with no seperate lounge area for residents, to the point that on the night of the  "gala" evening, it was stopped at 10;00pm because they needed to set up the tables for breakfast, Breakfast was basic continental style,while dinner had to be ordered the previous evening, only one serving time, with few staff, (who were very friendly & helpful) which lead to slow service,so if your partner had ordered something different from you either your's or their meal would be cold by the time the other meal arrived, This said the hotel is in an ideal location and is spotlessly clean

title: Bring back Antonio
review: Great location and nice hotel. Service down on last year and food would be best described as poor (sloopy mashed potatoes and meat first night and no veg.) Morning coffee is instant variety! Head waiter and staff much better last year. Overall not to bad as plenty of reasonably  food options in town including 3 supermarkets..

title: Great week and excellent value for money
review: Stayued at Hotel Portici in trip with Travel department. The Hoetel eas excellent and staff very helpful and friendly. Good breakfast which set you up for the day and the  evening meal was varied and very acceptable. The three tours which were included were very good value and our tour guid Antionette was very informative and helpful. Riva is an excellent resort with plenty going on lively nightlife, good bars and entertainment each nigh at various venues. All in all an excellent weeks hiloiday and good value

title: Hotel PoorFood Great place
review: Hotel Portici is located in a fantastic place in Riva - close to the ferry port, bars and restaurants and being in a pedestrian square no traffic noise.  Lots of entertainment reasonably priced and even free concerts in the museum.  We had an apartment rather than a hotel room which was basic, but very spacious and had a full size fridge which proved very useful.    Breakfast was good with alot of choice.  We stayed half board as that was the only option available on the last minute deal - food was very poor.  Very little choice on menu, restricted times to eat ( you choose your food 24 hours before and it is obviously cooked for 7pm whether you are there or not, as was often cold and dried out), powdered soup (I know this because I could see lumps of powder in it), one evening…

title: room for improvement
review: just back from riva ,stayed in portici hotel, guide who left us to hotel very helpful,  on arriving rooms very plain but clean. breakfast filling more than enough to set you up for the day. evening meals now thats another story,  overcooked salmon no taste ,  loads of salad, but after two nights gets boring, no vegetables all week , but on last nite dinner good, pity they didnt serve this type of meal during week. had to go out one of nites to a resturant along promenade, meal top notch, now the food at front of hotel was lovely to look at it ,but we were in back of resturant eating school dinners, Maria pia, our guide was wonderful we left italy with so much knowledge of  their country, big big hoorey for maria.

title: Could be better
review: I spent a week in Riva Del Garda.on Lake Garda, organised by the Travel Department. There were three coach tours in the price, around the lake, Verona, and Venice. All in all the holiday was good value for money. The trips were well organised. The location of the hotel was excellent. The hotel cleanliness was also v. goood.  The one major criticism of this package was the food.  There was very limited choice i.e choice fo two starters/main meal.  The food order had to be placed the day before.  The was also no flexibility with meals times, food was served at 19:30 sharp and the group had to be seated at this time.  The was also compulsory allocation of seating at the tables, each couple was placed with another couple (unknown to them) and they eat together every night. Not the…

title: Holiday on Lake Garda
review: I spent a week in Riva Del Garda.on Lake Garda, organised by the Travel Department. There were three coach tours in the price, around the lake, Verona, and Venice. Our tour guide was a man called Martin, who did everything he could for all our travelling companions. He was very pleasant, cooperative, knowledgeable, and helpful in every way, altogether a real nice guy. We stayed at the Hotel Portici,a very good place to stay. The staff were extremely pleasant and courteous, the hotel itself was very clean and comfortable. My only criticism of it would be that the food, whilst being fairly good the menu was somewhat limited and for a few extra pounds on the holiday price it would have come up to the same standard as everything else in the hotel. An example would be, one night we…

title: 'Perfect Location'
review: Just Back From 'Riva Lake Garda, and have to say it was a great holiday.  I booked my holiday through The Belfast Telegraph, (Travel Department) and it was very well organised, everything ran perfectly.   A special word of 'Thanks' for giving us a wonderful guide called 'Maria Pia' she could'nt do enough for us.   I found the hotel basic but very clean.  We had fresh towels everyday and bedding changed once a week. Rooms comfortable and cosy. The food was quite good, especially if you are not into italian food, i found that i never left feeling hungry, there was always something you could eat.( for me it was the salad, it was delicious, loads of it) Most of the staff was very good and helpful,  The hotel is a perfect location for restaurants, shops,etc, and the lake is right in…

title: room for improvement
review: Just back from a super week staying in Riva. We booked our holiday thru" The Travel Department" and I must congratulate them on the way they handled everything ,from the smooth arrival to our departure. An extra special mention to our guide for the week "ANNALISA." She was incredibly informative, polite and put herself out to please eveyone, a million thanks to her for the energy and effort she put in. Now as far as The  Portici goes, its location sells it. The reception staff are very accomodating and helpful. The waiting staff however are less so, abrupt on occasions, even going as far as clicking their fingers to get you to hand over your dishes when finished instead of going round the table to collect them. Meals can become repetative, but do improve slightly as the week…

title: Loved the Hotel Portici
review: Lake garda - Hotel portici - Riva  Riva is a beautiful place surrounded by mountains and the hotel was a stone's throw from the lake.  We stayed here half board for 1 week as part of an organised tour The room was quite spacious, had all the  necessities and was kept very clean.  The dining room staff in particular were very friendly and we had great craic once they got to know us. I am not a lover of Italian food but I never came away hungry.  I would have no hesitation reccommending this hotel .

title: perfecto portici
review: 2 weeks for the price of 1 meant to wonderful weeks spent here. Traveling on my own all staff without exception were kindness itself. rooms and common areas spotless bright and cheerful. Asked for fan(pevious contributors recommendation) and also slept with windows open (room 110) enjoying cacophony of street sounds(all quite by midnight) others didnt even bother with a fan.Food on half board option fine and tasty ,but bigger portions are given when HB booked independently. To be honest if you are a couple on a package use the HB option as a backup and go and sample all the wonderful romantic restaurants in Riva. Riva is a fabulous place as is Lake Garda can't wait to go back.

title: spotless but basic
review: Booked a holiday with the travel department to Lake Garda and Lake Como. Hotel Portici was our first stop in Riva. The hotel could not have been positioned in a better place... its on the main square surrounded by restaurants and cafes. The hotel looked spotless from the start and did not disappoint as the stay progressed. The dinner was NOT what one would expect in italy therefore we didnt eat in again!! however other people in our group said it did improve. The room was small however it had a great view. It was cleaned to a very high standard every day, however although it sounds picky... the towels were [--]... just drying and no more.  Overall i would say the hotel was basic but ideally located and spotless, so can't really complain!!

title: Ideally situated
review: Hi..Just come back from staying at his hotel and like other reviews I found it to be basic . The rooms were cleaned and bedlinen changed daily.There is no  air conditioning but if you ask at reception they will give you a fan. The breakfast was good..ie tea, toast, cereal, yogurts, juice etc and the dinner was at 7.30pm. It was ok..you always get pasta for starters, then dinner...service could be a bit slow and you could have as much salad as you want with it....then dessert. This hotel is ideally situated close to Lake Garda and shops.

title: Mixed Fortunes
review: The hotel is in a perfect location, just yards from the lake and two minutes from the quayside where boats to a number of various towns and villages can be booked.  The hotel itself is very basic but spotlessly clean with pleasant staff.  The food left much to be desired unless you happened to be Italian!  My major complaint, which none of the other reviews have mentioned, is that there isno air conditioning which made sleeping almost impossible.           John and Alma Brough Ballymen

title: room, yes. meals, no.
review: I attended a week long conference at Riva del Garda and stayed at Hotel Portici 24/5 - 30/5/08.  The room (4th floor) was spotless, spacious and comfortable. But. Do not stay on a half board basis. When staying half board you are forced to order from a limited, inferior menu. No salads, not a fresh ingredient in sight. Just congealed, stodgy stuff, slimy gnocchi, dodgy salmon. When ordering prosciutto you will get boiled spam ham so be sure to ask for "parma ham" or "crudo". Breakfast was a similar nasty affair: tinned fruit in syrup! Egg boiled beyond its critical mass. At least the coffee was good. And the wine! So, if you like your meals bland/generic - Portici is the place to eat.  If you enjoy authentic and fresh, then book your stay on a room only basis.

title: friendly portici
review: This is a small hotel, but suitable as a base when visiting the area. Although it is basic, it is very clean and is right on the waterfront. The bedrooms are thoroughly cleaned daily. All of the staff are very friendly and helpful. There is always a very good and jovial atmosphere around the place. Evening meal time was at a set time for everyone (thankfully breakfast was not and we could have a lie in), as a result service in the restaurant in the evenings could be a bit slow at times, despite everyone having chosen their meals the evening before. We would go back. WGT Newtownards

title: great portici
review: Stayed in Hotel Portici for full week great time good food  clean ro oms and friendly staff perfectley situated for young and old.a minutes walk to great views of lake garda  will go back again philip +julie newtownabbey May 2008

title: Excellent stay in Hotel Portici
review: We have just returned from a weeks stay in the Hotel Portici. This hotel is in an excellent location in the old town square of Riva, close to the harbour, shops, bars and restaurants. We stayed in a room on the second floor, which was a fair size and was spotlessly clean. The hotel staff, without exception, were friendly and extremely helpful. As we were in a coach trip we stayed half board. The food was fine, but quite small portions and not a great deal of choice. Overall, this is an excellent hotel in a spectacular location!

title: Excellent stay!
review: We have just spent a week at the Hotel Portici and really enjoyed our stay. Our room was on the 4th floor overlooking the square and with a view of the snow capped mountains. We were just beside the lift but I know some other rooms could not be reached by the lift so bear that in mind. The room was spotless with very comfortable beds and a wet room rather than a shower room which suited us. We were with a coach party and the food was just satisfactory but we didn't starve. Riva is a beautiful resort with lots of places to walk and I could have spent my week there rather than on our included excursions to Venice and Verona which frankly were both disappointing.

title: Delightful!
review: This hotel is very simple, and spotlessly clean.  Food was great and the location was perfect.  The down side is the small lift does not cater for all the floors where bedrooms are located, but we were fit and even fitter when we left! There is no communal area for guests to locate to except the Bar and Restaurant areas,  but we spent no  time in the hotel during the day and in the evenings we were located in the Bar!

title: A quirky, highly enjoyable establishment - squeaky clean, great food
review: I was very taken with this establishment.  It's perfect for a place like Riva del Garda, where you spend as little time as possible indoors, but when you do, good food and drink are crucial.  The staff were wonderfully friendly and helpful (the dining room supervisor led us in a stirring conga line through the hotel after dinner one night) and the standard of housekeeping is exceptionally high.  We were on half-board, and I thoroughly enjoyed all my meals, even the breakfasts, which are not usually a positive feature in Italian hotels.  It's not the Cipriani, folks, but if you want a good, clean room with excellent plumbing and a firm mattress, helpful and friendly staff, and a top-notch restaurant and bar, all at reasonable prices, this is the place for you.  I enjoyed this…

title: Very authentic Italian
review: Hotel Portici has a lovely setting within the main Piazza in Riva del Garda.  we had a lovely relaxing holiday, very picturese by the Lake.  As we were with a group the food was not what it could have been.  we did eat seperately one evening nad the food was very good.  Riva is a magical place can't wait to go back.  Liz Jones
